title.narrative: Enhancing Food security, livelihoods recovery and nutrition status for children, returning refugees,

description.narrative: This project seeks to ameliorate the suffering of displaced persons and returnees with a focus on women and children who constitute the bulk of the displaced persons and at-risk host families. The project will provide lifesaving assistance to 1,500 (655) households who have children suffering from malnutrition and preventable communicable diseases due to poor access to safe water, hygiene, and sanitation practices. It will strengthen the capacity for food self-sufficiency for 1,500 households (80% women headed households) as primary beneficiaries and 7,500 (3,276) individuals, as secondary beneficiaries in Owach and Nyiluak payams of Panyikang County in the former Upper Nile State. Amongst the indirect beneficiaries of food and vegetables production will be under 5-year-old children who suffer the most from high levels of malnutrition in the area. The project will reduce dependency on handouts by providing training and resources for agriculture, access to clean water, hygiene promotion and specific support for women and girls to overcome gender-based barriers and improve coping strategies. In addition, peace is indispensable to successful project implementation and hence the project will mainstream peacebuilding and promote peaceful co-existence amongst the different ethnic communities in the project area.
